meanings.definition: The top member of a cornice, crowning molding, or entablature, projecting beyond the bed moldings or other moldings below and often having a drip.
meanings.sent1: The cymatium added a decorative touch to the building's exterior.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully designed the cymatium to enhance the overall look of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the cymatium, pretending to be the king of the castle.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the cymatium cast a long shadow over the courtyard.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details of the cymatium caught the eye of every passerby.

meanings.definition: A molding of the cornice of the Ionic order, having the shape of a wave.
meanings.sent1: The elegant cymatium beautifully complemented the Ionic columns.
meanings.sent2: The cymatium on the Ionic cornice resembled a gentle wave.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined surfing on the cymatium as they played in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, bouncing off the cymatium like a wave.
meanings.sent5: The cymatium's design evoked a sense of movement and fluidity in the architecture.
